performance.中释: 性能；绩效；表演；执行；表现
performance.英释: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

institution.中释: 制度；建立；（社会或宗教等）公共机构；习俗
institution.英释: a large organization that has a particular kind of work or purpose

publication.英释: The publication of a book or magazine is the act of printing it and sending it to stores to be sold

opportunity.英释: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

translation.英释: when you translate something, or something that has been translated

environment.英释: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

consequence.英释: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

competition.英释: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

consumption.英释: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

association.中释: 协会，联盟，社团；联合；联想
association.英释: an organization that consists of a group of people who have the same aims, do the same kind of work etc

possibility.中释: 可能性；可能发生的事物
possibility.英释: if there is a possibility that something is true or that something will happen, it might be true or it might happen

philosopher.英释: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

intelligent.中释: 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的
intelligent.英释: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

description.英释: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

demonstrate.英释: to show or prove something clearly

interesting.中释: 有趣的；引起兴趣的，令人关注的
interesting.英释: if something is interesting, you give it your attention because it seems unusual or exciting or provides information that you did not know about

appointment.英释: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

transaction.中释: 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报
transaction.英释: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

application.中释: 应用；申请；应用程序；敷用
application.英释: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

furthermore.英释: in addition to what has already been said

competitive.中释: 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

explanation.英释: the reasons you give for why something happened or why you did something

corporation.中释: 公司；法人（团体）；社团；大腹便便；市政当局
corporation.英释: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

controversy.英释: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

personality.英释: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

requirement.英释: something that someone needs or asks for

acknowledge.中释: 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到
acknowledge.英释: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

communicate.中释: 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染
communicate.英释: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

alternative.中释: 二中择一；供替代的选择
alternative.英释: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

distinguish.中释: 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出
distinguish.英释: to recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people

superfluous.中释: 多余的；不必要的；奢侈的
superfluous.英释: more than is needed or wanted

acquisition.英释: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

legislation.英释: a law or set of laws

expectation.英释: what you think or hope will happen

concentrate.英释: a substance or liquid which has been made stronger by removing most of the water from it

indignation.英释: feelings of anger and surprise because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

composition.中释: 作文，作曲，作品；[材] 构成；合成物；成分
composition.英释: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

appropriate.英释: to take something for yourself when you do not have the right to do this

indifferent.中释: 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的
indifferent.英释: not at all interested in someone or something

implication.中释: 含义；暗示；牵连，卷入；可能的结果，影响
implication.英释: a possible future effect or result of an action, event, decision etc

statistical.英释: Statistical means relating to the use of statistics

comparative.英释: the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

disposition.中释: 处置；[心理] 性情；[军] 部署；倾向
disposition.英释: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

nonetheless.英释: in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned

participant.英释: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

shortcoming.英释: a fault or weakness that makes someone or something less successful or effective than they should be

declaration.中释: （纳税品等的）申报；宣布；公告；申诉书
declaration.英释: an important official statement about a particular situation or plan, or the act of making this statement

convenience.英释: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

fashionable.中释: 流行的；时髦的；上流社会的
fashionable.英释: popular, especially for a short period of time

complicated.英释: difficult to understand or deal with, because many parts or details are involved

masterpiece.英释: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

recognition.中释: 识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认
recognition.英释: the act of realizing and accepting that something is true or important

pessimistic.中释: 悲观的，厌世的；悲观主义的
pessimistic.英释: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

observation.英释: the process of watching something or someone carefully for a period of time

accommodate.英释: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

manufacture.英释: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts

probability.中释: 可能性；机率；[数] 或然率
probability.英释: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

sympathetic.中释: 交感神经；容易感受的人

investigate.英释: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

instruction.中释: 指令，命令；指示；教导；用法说明
instruction.英释: the written information that tells you how to do or use something

preparation.英释: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

documentary.英释: a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

collaborate.英释: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

consolidate.英释: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

replacement.中释: 更换；复位；代替者；补充兵员
replacement.英释: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before

spontaneous.中释: 自发的；自然的；无意识的
spontaneous.英释: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

superiority.英释: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

bureaucracy.中释: 官僚主义；官僚机构；官僚政治
bureaucracy.英释: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc

certificate.英释: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

counterpart.中释: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
counterpart.英释: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

proficiency.英释: a good standard of ability and skill

predecessor.英释: someone who had your job before you started doing it

participate.英释: to take part in an activity or event

maintenance.中释: 维护，维修；保持；生活费用
maintenance.英释: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

temperament.英释: the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc

constituent.英释: being one of the parts of something

accordingly.英释: in a way that is suitable for a particular situation or that is based on what someone has done or said

discrepancy.英释: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

proposition.英释: to suggest to someone that they have sex with you

innumerable.英释: very many, or too many to be counted

combination.中释: 结合；组合；联合；[化学] 化合
combination.英释: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

renaissance.英释: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

approximate.英释: an approximate number, amount, or time is close to the exact number, amount etc, but could be a little bit more or less than it

considerate.中释: 体贴的；体谅的；考虑周到的
considerate.英释: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

spectacular.中释: 壮观的，惊人的；公开展示的

scholarship.英释: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

expenditure.英释: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

conjunction.中释: 结合；[语] 连接词；同时发生
conjunction.英释: a combination of different things that have come together by chance

inspiration.英释: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

homogeneous.中释: 均匀的；[数] 齐次的；同种的；同类的，同质的
homogeneous.英释: Homogeneous is used to describe a group or thing which has members or parts that are all the same

disturbance.英释: a situation in which people behave violently in public

theoretical.中释: 理论的；理论上的；假设的；推理的
theoretical.英释: relating to the study of ideas, especially scientific ideas, rather than with practical uses of the ideas or practical experience

orientation.中释: 方向；定向；适应；情况介绍；向东方
orientation.英释: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

supermarket.中释: 超级市场；自助售货商店
supermarket.英释: a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes

extravagant.中释: 奢侈的；浪费的；过度的；放纵的
extravagant.英释: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

reservation.英释: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

installment.中释: 安装；分期付款；部分；就职

destruction.英释: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

cooperative.英释: a business or organization owned equally by all the people working there

catastrophe.英释: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

destructive.中释: 破坏的；毁灭性的；有害的，消极的
destructive.英释: causing damage to people or things

necessitate.英释: to make it necessary for you to do something

countryside.中释: 农村，乡下；乡下的全体居民
countryside.英释: land that is outside cities and towns

qualitative.英释: relating to the quality or standard of something rather than the quantity

contaminate.英释: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

superficial.中释: 表面的；肤浅的 ；表面文章的；外表的；（人）浅薄的
superficial.英释: not studying or looking at something carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things

distinction.中释: 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章
distinction.英释: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

improvement.英释: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

temperature.英释: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

agriculture.中释: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
agriculture.英释: the practice or science of farming

preliminary.英释: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

transparent.中释: 透明的；显然的；坦率的；易懂的
transparent.英释: if something is transparent, you can see through it

obstruction.英释: an offence in football, hockey etc in which a player gets between an opponent and the ball

troublesome.中释: 麻烦的；讨厌的；使人苦恼的
troublesome.英释: causing problems, in an annoying way

radioactive.英释: a radioactive substance is dangerous because it contains  radiation (= a form of energy that can harm living things )

destination.英释: the place that someone or something is going to

consecutive.英释: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

resemblance.中释: 相似；相似之处；相似物；肖像
resemblance.英释: if there is a resemblance between two people or things, they are similar, especially in the way they look

loudspeaker.英释: a piece of equipment used to make sounds louder

electricity.中释: 电力；电流；强烈的紧张情绪
electricity.英释: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

progressive.英释: A progressive is someone who is progressive

incorporate.中释: 合并的；一体化的；组成公司的

predominant.中释: 主要的；卓越的；支配的；有力的；有影响的
predominant.英释: If something is predominant, it is more important or noticeable than anything else in a set of people or things

anniversary.英释: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

preposition.英释: a word that is used before a noun,  pronoun  , or  gerund  to show place, time, direction etc. In the phrase ‘the trees in the park’, ‘in’ is a preposition.

magnificent.中释: 高尚的；壮丽的；华丽的；宏伟的
magnificent.英释: very good or beautiful, and very impressive

nationality.英释: the state of being legally a citizen of a particular country

operational.英释: working and ready to be used

merchandise.英释: to try to sell goods or services using methods such as advertising

contemplate.英释: to look at someone or something for a period of time in a way that shows you are thinking

refreshment.中释: 点心；起提神作用的东西；精力恢复
refreshment.英释: small amounts of food and drink that are provided at a meeting, sports event etc

imagination.中释: [心理] 想象力；空想；幻想物
imagination.英释: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

commemorate.英释: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

imaginative.中释: 富于想象的；有创造力的

thermometer.英释: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

information.英释: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

coincidence.中释: 巧合；同时发生；符合，一致
coincidence.英释: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual
